intro: Cynoglossum shepardii, commonly known as Shepard's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in dry, open areas. Its leaves are hairy and somewhat heart-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in a terminal spike. It is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
